Package dev.sergiferry.playernpc.api

Class NPC

java.lang.Object
dev.sergiferry.playernpc.api.NPC
public class NPC extends Object
NPC instance per player. An NPC can only be seen by one player. This is because of personalization purposes. With this instance you can create customizable Player NPCs that can be interacted with. NPCs will be only visible to players after creating the EntityPlayer, and show it to the player.
Since:
2021.1

  • Method Details

    • create

      public NPC create()
      Creates the entityPlayer of the NPC, but it doesn't show it to the player until show().
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if skin equals null
      IllegalArgumentException - if isCreated() equals true because it means that the entityPlayer is created yet.
      Since:
      2021.1
      See Also:
      show()

    • update

      public NPC update()
      Updates the attributes of the NPC. Some changes will need forceUpdate()
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      Since:
      2021.1
      See Also:
      update(), forceUpdate()

    • forceUpdate

      public NPC forceUpdate()
      Re-creates the entityPlayer, and updates all the attributes. This is useful after doing some big changes to the NPC, like setting the skin, glowing color, or collision rule. Methods that require this force update will be documented. Otherwise use update()
      Returns:
      The NPC instance
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if player equals null
      IllegalArgumentException - if isCreated() equals false
      Since:
      2021.1
      See Also:
      create(), isCreated(), update()

    • teleport

      public NPC teleport​(org.bukkit.World world, double x, double y, double z, float yaw, float pitch)
      Teleports entityPlayer to the specified coordinate. This method automatically updates to the Player client.
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinate
      y - Y coordinate
      z - Z coordinate
      yaw - Yaw horizontal
      pitch - Pitch vertical
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if isCreated() equals false
      Since:
      2021.1
      See Also:
      isCreated(), teleport(Entity), teleport(Location), teleport(double, double, double)

    • teleport

      public NPC teleport​(@Nonnull org.bukkit.entity.Entity entity)
      Teleports entityPlayer to Entity.getLocation() This method automatically updates to the Player client.
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity that will teleport to.
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if Entity.getWorld() is different of getWorld()
      IllegalArgumentException - if isCreated() equals false
      Since:
      2021.1
      See Also:
      isCreated(), teleport(Location), teleport(double, double, double), teleport(double, double, double, float, float)

    • teleport

      public NPC teleport​(@Nonnull org.bukkit.Location location)
      Teleports entityPlayer to the specified Location. This method automatically updates to the Player client.
      Parameters:
      location - The location that will teleport to.
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if location is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if location's Location.getWorld() is not the same as world
      IllegalArgumentException - if isCreated() equals false
      Since:
      2021.1
      See Also:
      isCreated()

    • teleport

      public NPC teleport​(double x, double y, double z)
      Teleports entityPlayer to the specified coordinate. This method automatically updates to the Player client.
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinate
      y - Y coordinate
      z - Z coordinate
      Returns:
      the NPC instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if isCreated() equals false
      Since:
      2021.1
      See Also:
      isCreated()

    • setItem

      public NPC setItem​(@Nonnull NPC.Slot slot, @Nullable org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack itemStack)
      Sets the equipment of the NPC with the ItemStack at the specified NPC.Slot. If isCreated(), you must use update() to show it to the Player
      Parameters:
      slot - The slot that the item will be equipped.
      itemStack - The itemStack that will be equipped.
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if slot equals null
      Since:
      2021.1
      See Also:
      update()

      public NPC clearEquipment​(@Nonnull NPC.Slot slot)
      Clears the equipment of the NPC at the specified NPC.Slot If isCreated(), you must use update() to show it to the Player

    • updateText

      public NPC updateText()
      Updates the npcHologram. If the amount of lines is different at the previous text, use forceUpdateText()
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      Since:
      2021.1
      See Also:
      forceUpdateText()

    • forceUpdateText

      public NPC forceUpdateText()
      Re-creates the npcHologram. If the amount of lines is the same as the previous text, use updateText()
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      Since:
      2021.1
      See Also:
      updateText()

    • destroy

      public NPC destroy()
      Destroys the NPC, and can be created after. To definitely destroy and remove the NPC instance use NPCLib.removeNPC(Player, NPC)
      Returns:
      The NPC instance
      Since:
      2021.1
      See Also:
      NPCLib.removeNPC(Player, NPC), NPCLib.removeNPC(Player, String)

    • show

      public NPC show()
      Shows the NPC to the player. It must be isCreated() to show it. To hide it after, use hide(). This method calls NPC.Events.Show.
      Returns:
      The NPC instance
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if getPlayer() equals null
      IllegalArgumentException - if isCreated() equals false
      Since:
      2021.1
      See Also:
      isCreated(), create(), hide()

    • hide

      public NPC hide()
      Hides the NPC from the player. It must be isCreated() to hide it. To show it again, use show(). This method calls NPC.Events.Hide.
      Returns:
      The NPC instance
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if getPlayer() equals null
      IllegalArgumentException - if isCreated() equals false
      Since:
      2021.1
      See Also:
      isCreated(), create(), show()

    • lookAt

      public NPC lookAt​(@Nonnull org.bukkit.entity.Entity entity)
      Sets the direction that the NPC will look to the location of the Entity. If isCreated(), you must use update() to show it to the Player
      Parameters:
      entity - The entity that will look at.
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if entity equals null
      Since:
      2021.1
      See Also:
      update()

    • lookAt

      public NPC lookAt​(@Nonnull org.bukkit.Location location)
      Sets the direction that the NPC will look to the Location. If isCreated(), you must use update() to show it to the Player
      Parameters:
      location - The location that will look at.
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if location equals null
      IllegalArgumentException - if NPC is not created yet
      IllegalArgumentException - if the location's world is not the same as the NPC's world.
      Since:
      2021.1
      See Also:
      update()

      Parameters:
      yaw -
      pitch -
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.

    • setHideText

      public NPC setHideText​(boolean hide)
      Hides or shows the text above the NPC, but without losing the text information.
      Parameters:
      hide - boolean if the text will be hidden or not
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      Since:
      2021.1

      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      Since:

      See Also:

    • setSkin

      public NPC setSkin​(@Nonnull String texture, @Nonnull String signature)
      Sets the NPC.Skin of the NPC. If isCreated(), you must use forceUpdate() to show it to the Player
      Parameters:
      texture - Texture of the skin
      signature - Signature of the skin
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      Since:

    • setSkin

      public NPC setSkin​(@Nonnull String texture, @Nonnull String signature, @Nullable String playerName)
      Sets the NPC.Skin of the NPC. If isCreated(), you must use forceUpdate() to show it to the Player
      Parameters:
      texture - Texture of the skin
      signature - Signature of the skin
      playerName - Name of the skin owner, this is not necessary, but it will store it on the NPC.Skin instance.
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      Since:
      2021.1
      See Also:
      forceUpdate()

    • setSkin

      public NPC setSkin​(@Nullable String playerName)
      Sets the NPC.Skin of the NPC. If isCreated(), you must use forceUpdate() to show it to the Player
      Parameters:
      playerName - Name of the skin owner. It will fetch skin even if the player is not online.
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      Since:
      2021.1
      See Also:
      forceUpdate()

    • setSkin

      public NPC setSkin​(@Nullable org.bukkit.entity.Player playerSkin)
      Sets the NPC.Skin of the NPC. If isCreated(), you must use forceUpdate() to show it to the Player
      Parameters:
      playerSkin - Player that is online, that will fetch skin.
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      Since:
      2021.1
      See Also:
      forceUpdate()

    • setSkin

      public NPC setSkin​(@Nullable NPC.Skin npcSkin)
      Sets the NPC.Skin of the NPC. If isCreated(), you must use forceUpdate() to show it to the Player
      Parameters:
      npcSkin - NPC.Skin with the texture and signature.
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      Since:
      2021.1
      See Also:
      forceUpdate()

    • clearSkin

      public NPC clearSkin()
      Sets the NPC.Skin of the NPC as the Default minecraft skin. If isCreated(), you must use forceUpdate() to show it to the Player
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      Since:
      2021.1
      See Also:
      forceUpdate()

    • setText

      public NPC setText​(@Nonnull List<String> text)
      Sets the text above the NPC. If isCreated(), you must use updateText() if there are the same amount of lines or forceUpdateText() if there are different amount of lines, to show it to the Player
      Parameters:
      text - The text above the NPC, each String will be one line.
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      Since:
      2021.1
      See Also:

    • setCustomTabListName

      public NPC setCustomTabListName​(@Nullable String name, boolean show)
      Sets the custom tab list name NPC, and if it's showing or not. If isCreated(), you must use forceUpdate() to show it to the Player
      Parameters:
      name - The name will be visible at tab list. "{UUID}" will replace the uuid of the NPC. It cannot be larger than 16 characters, and it can be the same as another NPC.
      show - Whether it's showing or not.
      Returns:
      The NPC instance.
      Since:
      2021.1
      See Also:
      forceUpdate(), setCustomTabListName(String), setShowOnTabList(boolean)
